snippet.title: New twist on Dickens tale
snippet.content: IT MAY be August, but the seniors at Haileybury are inviting you to join in their Christmas cheer. The school is staging its version of Charles Dickens' tale A Christmas Carol. Drama teacher and play director Nicole Smith said the story started in modern-day Melbourne, but the cast was drawn into the Christmas carol story. "So even though we start in a comic way, we get back to the traditional story. It's quite interesting how poignant the story of the wealth and isolation of Scrooge is still relevant," Ms Smith said. A Christmas Carol is from August 8 to 10, at 7.30pm, at the school's Keysborough campus, 855 Springvale Rd. Tickets are available via trybooking.com/QNJW or at the door.
